comments.name: 老张说车

comments.name: Global_Vision
comments.content: Wow, S&P potentially dipping for two straight weeks, and Intel tanking 18% after its Q1 guidance was a bummer? That’s quite a hit. It really shows how fragile market sentiment can be, especially with the AI hype not fully translating into immediate corporate earnings for everyone. And the Fed waiting until June for a rate cut? That’s later than expected. It’s a completely different vibe compared to the market expectations back in December. I mean, the global economy is so interconnected, what happens in the US, especially with interest rates, has a ripple effect everywhere. It’s like, you gotta keep an eye on everything, not just local news. Makes you rethink your investment strategy, doesn't it?
